inn1.comm: excellent line and length to start proceedings, just zipping past Tharanga's vertical bat
good bowling again, angling across the left-hander and threatening to graze the edge. Mustard stoops low to take
slightly straighter and nipping back into the pads of the left-hander. Clipped off the toes for the first run of the match
full length, on off stump, nudged leg-side
a bit of a swish outside off, but the ball doesn't take off at all. Skids through low, and not a lot of movement either
an effort ball to finish, but again it doesn't get up much. Outside off stump and left well alone
full and straight, rapped on the pads and a huge appeal from Sidebottom - so huge that he falls over in doing so. But there was a fat inside-edge on that one
too much width on that one
that's better, floated into the slot and a wafty drive ensues. No contact
straighter and fuller, defended out to point with a loud click of the bat
lovely line and length, zippier delivery that time
Tharanga shoulders arms as Sidebottom hits the seam and nips one away towards the slips
tight bowling from Sidebottom, nothing much to work with for the Sri Lankans
in the slot for the drive, but pushed firmly out to cover where it's fielded with quick hands. No run there
full and straight, defended back down the pitch and a jogged single
shorter and on the hips, turned away with a flick of the wrists
shaping into the left-hander's pads, and tucked into the leg-side again
brisk bowling, but not a lot of menace. Respectfully played nonetheless
another tidy over. Tharanga raises his bat with a touch of alarm after playing his defensive stroke, as if the ball had done a bit off the pitch. I'm not sure it did though
good areas, Sidey, as his team-mates are doubtless saying
a bit of lift outside off stump, left well alone
short and passes high over Jayasuriya's shoulder as he shapes to duck
wider outside off stump, and a massive yahoo from Jayasuriya. No contact, luckily for the batsman
turned calmly into the leg-side again. Runs coming at a trickle at present
ripping delivery, angling back into the left-hander and holding its line outside off. Tharanga defended and just kept his bat inside the line
yet more good areas to complete a tidy over. Slightly wider of off stump this time, but the same result
a stifled appeal as Anderson raps the pads, but nothing doing from umpire de Silva
defended into the leg-side, good variation of length
and there's the first boundary of the match. Nothing wrong with the line but too short from Anderson, and calmly steered into the gap behind point
fuller, straighter, defended
up and over from Tharanga - more of a Twenty20 shot and he was a bit lucky to clear mid-on. A better ball from Anderson too, full and straight. Signs of frustration?
dabbed into the covers and swiftly picked up. A more expensive over, but England will still be happy with this start
bending from middle-and-leg and defended in front of middle-and-off. Good bowling
defended again. None of Jayasuriya's favoured width is on offer here
on the legs and swatted up and over midwicket. Plugs ten yards inside the rope
full and angled into the pads, clipped fine and a scampered couple
more frustration from Jayasuriya, who hares down the track to give Sidebottom a wallop. But misses again as the ball nips off the seam
he's found the rope at last, a thick outside-edge off another good delivery. Third man is too wide to cut that off
good waspish line and length. Met with a straight bat and pushed down the ground
into position for the drive, but drilled straight to short cover
short and leg-sided. Might have been called wide if he hadn't made contact, but instead there's an easy couple as deep square leg sweeps round the boundary to field
short and on off stump. Defended off the back foot to point
full and a touch of width, slice-driven down to third man
run-down chance, but Collingwood's shy at the non-striker's end misses from point. Jayasuriya was too concerned with a partial lbw shout to go for the leg-bye, and Tharanga had to back-pedal
driven loosely on the up, and so nearly carries to Ian Bell at short cover. Nice bowling again, and more frustration
chopped down to gully, Cook tidies up
defended out to cover with bat and pad close together
slower ball, an offcutter, but Jayasuriya picked that and slotted it through the gap in the covers. Well played
back to more conventional seam-up. Defended watchfully off the back foot
that's more like the Jayasuriya we know. Pre-meditated gallop down the track, gave himself room to swing the arms, and rifled a ruthless cut through the covers
loose drive again from Tharanga - the bottom hand comes off his bat as he does so - but finds the gap comfortably enough
similar shot but better executed. Got his head over the ball and his weight going forward, and timed it to perfection too
fuller length as a response, and defended into the covers
bit of a fumble at cover, but a quick recovery. Can't save the single though
another charge from Jayasuriya but Anderson saw him coming and dragged it down. Good bowling
short again from Anderson and Jayasuriya goes back on his stumps to dab down to third man
one bounce and into the hoardings at deep cover! So nearly seven in seven
better line and length
zips off the seam and cramps Jayasuriya for room
another expansive swipe but is beaten by some extra bounce. Jayasuriya is desperate to get stuck in now
full and rapped on the pads, the ball bobbles out to midwicket
solid start, on the spot again, and that's the end of the first Powerplay
short and swiped off the back foot through midwicket. Starting to motor now ...
up, up and away! The first six of the innings, and just an easy pick-up, with the wind, over wide long-on
banged in down the leg-side, Jayasuriya goes after it, but can't make contact
wrong line again, Anderson is a bit rattled after those early blows. He also knows there's nothing in the pitch
better line and length this time, but a scampered single nonetheless
clubbed into the covers, half-stopped by a sprawling Collingwood
short and leg-sided, clipped to midwicket
that is precisely the wrong place to bowl to Jayasuriya when he's in the mood. A leg-stump long-hop, and that's pummelled behind square to complete a costly over
driven firmly into the covers, Collingwood fields with a slide
good line and length, driven back down the pitch
short and tight to off stump, Tharanga sways out of line
full and fired in at off stump from over the wicket, swung away by the left-hander, but not timed
steered out to point off the back foot
full and outside off stump, another attempted moo through the leg-side, but instead an under-edge to fine leg
outside off stump, and nibbles off the seam too. Good bowling
dropped That was a massive steepler, hit straight up in the air as Jayasuriya went for a swipe straight down the ground. James Anderson hurtled back from mid-on, but just couldn't steady himself
more measured response this time
no mistake this time! Jayasuriya had another mow across the line, but it was a slower ball and Ravi Bopara at deep midwicket had time to compose himself under a top-edged swirler
defended into the covers
half-stop from Bell in the covers saves two runs. That was powerfully struck
outside off stump and left alone
on off stump and nudged into the leg-side with a quick shuffle
good line and length, defended to point
short and swished at - the intention was an uppercut, but the ball wasn't there
outside off stump, another swish
tight bowling. But the dog is more interesting
nudged into the gap, but a much tidier over. Things have quietened down now Jayasuriya is out
defended off the back foot and played out to cover. Bell and Collingwood are being kept very busy. Not a lot is beating the bat at present
in the slot and clobbered straight down the ground again. Anderson does fantastically to catch up with the ball and claw it back into play inches inside the rope
an edge but fairly intentional. Possibly went finer than intended but races over the rope at third man
better shot, more bat on it, but only gets one for it, because it's too well timed and goes straight to third man. Figure that one out
slower ball and Sangakkara is deceived as he wafts airily outside off
perfect line and length, pushed back down the ground
steered to point where Bopara makes a hash of stopping it and the ball dribbles under him for a single
back and chopped into the ground, a quick call from the non striker and a well-run single
driven into the off side, extra cover in quickly to scotch thoughts of the run
tucked off his legs behind square, an easy two
stands tall and waits, punches off the back foot between fielders in the off-side ring
slanted across the left-hander, he shapes to cut but it's too close, he's too cramped and the ball scoots through to the keeper
placed with an open face into the off - he turned the bat with his wrists very late to steer into space. Sidebottom snarls from under his mop
fuller, driven high over the covers off the bottom of the bat ... with the ring in he can play that shot with safety
checked drive into the covers, straight to the fielder
steps back and prods with little follow through to Bell at  cover who is slightly deep but still there to prevent the one
back once more, this time he opts to whip it into the on side and there's two as the fielder in the deep has much ground to cover

defended to Sidebottom who is more intent on hurling the ball back at the striker and so ends up missing it altogether ... he smiles broadly as the batsmen run the one ... but would be so sanguine if it was someone else misfielding?
thumped to the right of  Pietersen at wide mid-off, he sticks out a hand and makes a good stop
angled to point, Bopara races in and never any chance of a run
slower ball, Sangakkara charges down the pitch and misses with a most ugly heave. That also kept a bit low ...
back and the ball misses the bat, a loud shout but much too high and an easy call for Rudi K, and it also pitched about a two feet outside leg stump
dug in, lovely bouncer which Tharanga ducks late
Tharanga gives Broad the charge, the bowler sees him coming and bangs it in, Tharanga, cramped, can do little more than swat at it and the ball loops gently to Collingwood at point ...
leg-stump line, keeps a bit low, pushed to wide midwicket
back, driven to mid-off, again with little bounce
worked behind square on the leg, Broad on the 45 pounces quickly
finally he finds a gap through midwicket to the man in the deep
a bit too much width, driven but not timed into the off side
plays from deep in the crease, running the ball down to third man
timed straight drive, Pietersen chases and catches the ball a yard or so short of the rope. Jayawardene brings up his 1000th ODI run of the year ...
back and chocked into the ground, the ball bobbles behind him and the keeper scurries up to the wickets to prevent a cheeky single
down the leg side, whipped off his pads but not timed and Mustard races to his right and makes a tumbling stop
again jabbed into the pitch, Broad  races down the track in his follow through to field
a good call for a quick single from Jayawardene to get Sangakkara off the strike
Jayawardene rocks back and hammers that square on the leg side ... well stopped in the deep but it bobbles out of his hands and that allows the batsmen to come back for two
limp drive to Bell at extra cover
bouncer, a good take by Mustard standing up
Sangakkara steps back and flicks the ball through midwicket
firm drive to mid-off ... the gaps just aren't there for the batsmen at the moment
short, pulled firmly square on the leg side, Sidebottom zooms round to his left and makes a sliding stop to restrict them to one ... well stopped but that should have been two
Sangakkara times one at last, through the covers
what a peach, rips past the bat as Sangakkara looked to push across the line
Sangakkara made to think again, and he decides to defend
looping delivery, pushed to mid-on
a tentative prod, beats the bat and a loud shout for lbw ...nothing doing
pushed into the off, a thought of a tip and run, but the field are in quickly
two steps to make a full delivery into a full toss, driven to long-on
pushed into the on side, Collingwood fields
twirled into the on side, happy for a single
another one that barely gets above ankle height, that's enough to fox Jayawardene who chops over it
defended across the line to mid-on
that one is timed but slapped right into the hands of Bell at extra cover and he fires ina  quick return to Mustard
driven to mid-on, concluding a really tight over
Sangakkara back and defends to mid-on
he skips down the pitch and misses, the ball thuds off his pads and into space
floated, he swipes across the line and is beaten, a loud shout but that hit him a long way outside the off stump but he was clueless
driven to long-on
chocked drive to midwicket, Bell dives and half stops and Sidebottom charges in to mop up
to long-on, a single ... and how many times will we write that in the next few overs ...
timed, a lovely late cut behind square on the off side, and finally a boundary after a long four famine
into the off side, nothing doing
shorter, well spotted by Jayawardene who leans back and helps the ball on its way, Broad runs to his left at third man to prevent the four
full toss, clipped firmly but stopped at midwicket
turned much finer on the leg side, an ambled single ... it's too hot for unnecessary sprinting
up in Sangakkara's blockhole and he can do no more than chop in back to Collingwood
well outside off, an ugly sweep which he misses, and a rather ridiculous appeal as well

dropped into the leg side, a yes-no moment, Sangakkara hesitated and Bopara's throw hit the stumps with the batsman short ... but Swann had knocked the bails off and he immediately told the umpire that as well ...
whipped from outside the off stump to Collingwood at midwicket
finally a heave from outside the off stump works, he sweeps that on the 45 on the leg side and between fielders
steps back to cut, gets a bat on it but that ripped in from outside off stump and was hitting had he misses
swished to deep cover
driven to long-off
firm drive into the off side, cover mops up
half volley slapped to Bell at short extra cover
short, Sangakkara shapes to pull but the ball barely gets up, it hits Mustard and bounces back to remove the off bail causing a moment of excitement in the office
Sangakkara really marooned ... he pats to midwicket
and he accepts the challenge, flicking the ball into space at midwicket
a bit too short, pushed up to long-on
turned square on the leg side, Anderson races in from the outback to field
pushed wide, Sangakkara comes to meet it and has to stretch to drive to long-off
Into space on the off side
firm drive back to Shah who fields from between the non-striker's legs
hit uppishly into the on side, lots of shouts but never a chance of a catch
finally some adventurous running, they take on the fielder and win
textbook cover drive, there's a man in the deep to plug that gap
flashing cover drive straight at Bell
slower than usual ball, heaved towards Anderson at long-on, he charges in, gets caught in two minds, stops and the ball bounces a few feet in front of him and he can't even stop the four
turned into the off side
well-timed drive to Anderson, no hiccups this time and he fires in an exocet-like throw
plopped to long-on, a walked single
filthy full toss got exactly what it deserved, thwacked behind square on the leg side
another full toss, not quite as filthy, drive to long-on
he walks across his stumps and helps that round the corner, a good call even though it was at the fielder
a run a ball, and everyone seems happy with this. But it's hardly exciting
and another single
driven out easily into the midwicket region
steps out to meet the ball outside off, on one knee, and sweeps confidently and almost dismissively in front of square
outside off and driven through cover for an easy single
outside off, Jayawardene down the track, to drive back out to mid-on
width outside off, driven safely through cover
driven through midwicket to steal the strike
wide down leg - a game sweep, but doesn't get too near it
outside off, crouches into a low cut behind point
comes from slightly wide to angle the left-hander who moves his body into a firm cover-drive but can only pick out the fielder
width outside off and Sangakkara could have done better with that cut which he plays too late (not a late cut, mind)
whipped off his hips behind square, to the man at deep backward square leg
stays over for the left hander and again Sangakkara misses out - a pre-meditated would-be hoick from outside off, a sort-of sweep on the back foot, crouching, which he doesn't connect with
bouncer to finish off, and Sangakkara deals with this one with no trouble, an easy duck under
outside off, driven on the front foot to mid-on
round the wicket, Sangakkara steps back (and then forward) and gives himself room to drive over cover
on leg, and tries to move it into the leg-side but doesn't quite connect with the timing he would have liked
steps back and crouches into a cut which he doesn't time
a top edge falls safely over deep square leg
deceived Sangakkara with one which pitched on middle-and-leg and turned way past his outside edge - Sangakkara had come down the track in a pre-meditated manner, and Mustard did the rest; tidily, too
right up there, defended forward
pushed right up there and defended on the back foot this time
strays on to leg, and worked round behind square - a well-taken, quick single results
outside off, good length, and a very firm defence meets the ball
cut into him from outside off, almost slicing him in half, like a magician and his beautiful assistant
outside off, wide and he climbs into a back-foot cut, solid as you like
outside off and late cut down to third man
outside off and played off the back foot with a solid defence
outside off and a big appeal as Jayawardene tried to sweep - it rapped him outside the line
played down to a straightish third man - a sort of second-and-a-half man if you like
worked out to short midwicket
a quick strike-stealing single
driven into the off for a comfortable single
swept to midwicket for another easy one
a little quicker, ripped through (comparatively) to Silva who waits, calm, and presents a straight face
worked down to third man this time
driven out to mid-on this time
oh, a bit of surprising lift there for Collingwood - so much so that a wide's given
outside off, driven out to mid-on
outside off, poked into the covers
not pretty - a pre-meditated reverse sweep which he doesn't connect with
more orthodox, and gets the result - a single from a clean cut to point
on off, tame enough, but patted back down
outside off, cut away off the back foot to deep point
outside off, driven out to mid-on where it's tidied up
dropped a return catch; a difficult one, too, Collingwood diving at full stretch wide to his right
driven out to extra cover for an easy single
outside off and "Catch" jokes Mustard as Jayawardene leans into a forthright cover drive that exocets along the floor... like the rat in Fawlty Towers
good slower to delivery to follow up from Collingwood, but well met with an easy defence
leans out from his body to press the bat on the off-side where it's well returned
swept round to Broad on the deep 45
outside off, some air on that one, driven out to mid-on for a comfortable one
reaches out for a firm sweep, but he doesn't connect
outside odd, driven out to the covers and as Sri Lanka come back for two off come the bails courtesy of a relay throw back to Swann. Safe
darting in on off and the batsman steps back to cut one that was aiming for his middle stump - and watches the ball right onto the bat, as is good practice, and out to point
defeated in the flight this time, the ball hopping outside his edge and on to Mustard
excellent work by Bell at extra cover - like a leaping salmon of a goalkeeper and other mixed metaphors - to cut that off
outside off, flayed through the covers to bring up the fifty. Great innings and he takes the applause by holding both hands on the bat as he lifts it high
more width, chopped down and on to Pietersen at third man
worked out to the covers
speared in outside off and driven out to cover
banged wide outside off and cut off the back foot to Shah, who's sweeping out there
outside off, even more width, off the back foot behind point
right over it, waited patiently, and worked into midwicket
waited patiently and driven to cover
cut out to point for a quick single
pushed right up there, darting in at the toes, and defended on the front foot
up there again, the ball popping up off the forward defence but landing very safe
driven back to the bowler
on leg, pulled around behind square
on off, rising slightly and surprising Silva whose top edge off a would-be pull lands way over Mustard
"Catch" suggests Mustard more in hope than expectation as the cover fielder jumps to his left to cut off the ball
played off the back foot behind point this time
worked out to the covers
outside off and there's a six! The second of the innings, driven over mid-on. Well connected
tight delivery, driven towards mid-on, Swann at full stretch to stop that one
an inside-out cover drive on the up, just creeping inside the boundary
worked in front of midwicket this time - Sri Lanka starting to cut loose now
good delivery this time, the ball nipping back and tempting the batsman into a drive, but gets an inside edge on to the pad
waits, walks into the delivery, and drives out to mid-on
on off, swept round behind fine leg
outside off, drives on the up and straight to Shah inside the cover boundary who watched it right into his clasping hands
swished off his feet to midwicket and they set off immediately - coming back for the second
reaches outside off to work down to third man
and he's off the mark straight away with a drive out towards Shah at extra cover
on middle and leg, turned off the legs for a comfortable single
a straight bouncer to round off and Mustard's broad beam shows how much he enjoyed that one
cutting in from outside off, rising, fended back down into the off-side
... and his intent is shown as Dilshan is surprised by the lift from that one - especially as this pitch is losing any pace he had
another swing and a miss
veering towards the legs and helped to leg off the hips
tries to bang it on, but doesn't really get the height (ironically enough for the tall man) and it's cut off the back foot, with some control
bouncer, and ducked periscopically which probably isn't a word
a good area (sing.), right up there and worked out wide of mid-on, the pair looking for a second but had to be content with a first only
started wide and turned wider - eluding Mustard's clutching paw - and that will go down as byes, somehow
short and somehow climbing, the batsman getting right over the pull to swivel it in front of square
Silva had decided enough was enough there, but unfortunately for him it was... hooking right down the throat of deep square leg
outside off, width, but cut into the ground
outside off and driven forward to Collingwood
across the left hander, worked into the off-side
outside off, wide on height terms. Broad is particularly unhappy about that, explaining to the umpire that he thought the batsman was ducking
outside off again, cut off the back foot to point
hooked low and straight: Anderson runs in hard from long leg and slides in to take a well-judged catch on his knees
on leg, swivelled round behind square
outside off lashed over backward point for four off the back foot - a very good shot on this surface
short and flat-pulled straightish towards mid-off; like a flat cut, really. Anyway, he retains the strike
outside off, in the blockhole straight away, Maharoof giving himself room to cut
rushed over straight and aerial
outside off, dug up and over towards cover
driven on the up to extra cover
across the right hander, driven out to the covers
outside off and the batsman makes a vain stab to cut away from his body
hoofed over mid-on for a comfortable two
driven off the back foot through extra cover
down leg and hooked high and gets away with it - Shah late over to the ball
scooped off the back foot through a very straight long-on
short and the batsman frees his arms to try to smash through square leg, but finds Shah there, marshalling
short delivery hops over the bat
another catch in the deep for Anderson, Maharoof going for the six over long-on
wide and driven into the covers
a quick single this time
good yorker, driven back to the bowler
low full toss and driven out to the covers
outside off, whooshed over to third man to round off a good final over

inn2.comm: outside off stump, and that barely gets above ankle-height on its way through to Sangakkara. Sluggish ...
pushed onto the back foot, and nurdled down to third man. England are on their way
off the mark, but monumentally streakily ... a genuine edge just dies on first slip, and scoots away to the boundary
that's a better shot, driven on the up with great power. But straight to the fielder
defended from well back in the crease
a touch of nibble off the seam, but nothing dramatic. A quietly eventful first over
pretty well as it turns out, fired into the pads and clipped firmly to backward square
sharp and straight, but the pitch is so sluggish that the ball almost reaches the bat on the second bounce. Defended with a perpendicular blade
pushed up to mid-off. Good pace again
outside off stump, no pace off the pitch again. Pushed into the covers
leg-stump line, but met with a vertical bat again. Pushed to midwicket
off target this time, pitching outside leg and angling further away. Cook merely aids that round the corner and uses the pace well
outside off stump, Mustard climbs into an urgent upper-cut-cum-drive, but doesn't time it
fuller and straighter, watched carefully onto the middle of the bat and pushed down to mid-on
a hint of width and Mustard chip-drives up and over the gully, where it's fielded by third man on the bounce. A Jayasuriya-esque stroke?
wicket to wicket delivery, but soooo slow off the deck. Defended with all the time in the world
watchfully played out to cover
a bit of a shimmy from Cook as he looks to get to the pitch of the ball, but Vaas drags it short and that's the end of the over
cracking timing, that wasn't a bad ball at all. Almost yorker-length, but on the legs and Mustard met that perfectly to send it whistling through midwicket
on the legs again, and clipped square
dragged short, and too wide as well. Cook just leans on his drive and threads it through the gap and all the way to the rope
perfect wicket-to-wicket line. Cook can only play dead-straight
wicket-to-wicket again. Defended again
on the pads, Cook tries to whip it away but can't time it. Sangakkara hustles up to the stumps to field
a hint of width and another punchy shot through the covers. Not perfectly timed, but good intent
tip-and-run. Sanath Jayasuriya hits with his shy from the covers, but Mustard is home
picks the gap in the covers
short and straight, clipped behind square on the off side
big stride and an attempt to work through the leg-side doesn't quite come off
tidy end to the over. England ticking along well
short and on the legs, clipped firmly but straight to midwicket
a hint of width outside off, but point tidies up an attempted steer
short and Cook shapes for the pull, but doesn't get hold of it properly
full and straight, defended back down the pitch
short of a length but straight and arrowing towards the top of off stump. There really is no bounce in this pitch whatsoever. Clipped to midwicket
drawn forward and driven down to mid-off
good length delivery, nipping a touch off the seam, steered into the off side
in the slot and slapped with immense power and timing! Mustard gave himself a touch of room, and clobbered that off a good length over long-off
outside off this time, and once again Mustard makes room to pepper the cover boundary. Deep cover dives in vain but never came close
banged in, but misdirected
driven again, but a touch streakily this time - Vaas was in with a chance of a sharp caught-and-bowled there. But it went over his head and safely away to no-man's land
better line, and defended
a touch of width, and excellent quick calling brings a single into the covers
short and pushed back onto the stumps. Defended back down the pitch
width and slapped square, but fielded with a tumble at point

a misjudgment, and Mustard falls. He tried once again to hit inside-out over the covers, but picked the wrong length for the shot. Maharoof dragged it back, and Mustard got underneath the stroke to chip a simple chance to a diving wide mid-off
outside off, pushed into the covers off the back foot
back of a length, Cook steps back and drives without any timing
whipped firmly through mid-on to complete the over
clipped down to long-on for a couple
defended down the track
wide outside off stump - Cook reaches without much foot movement, but times it well down to backward point
on the pads and whipped away firmly to deep midwicket
driven down the ground, but only as far as mid-on
drilled off the back foot but well plucked at short cover by Chamara Silva
Bell comes forward solidly to his first delivery and defends
a bit of pre-emptive foot movement from Bell, but defended all the same
hangs back in the crease this time, and defends again
fuller length, slower ball, targetting that blockhole. Bell waits ... and defends
very tidy bowling from Maharoof. Bell has no option but to come forward and defend again
a bit of width, and Bell scythes an attempted pull, but misses out. Good over
talking of powerplays, that was played with some power. Too much width from Fernando, and walloped through the off side
width again, but too full too cut. Cook almost falls over as the ball scuttles beneath his bat
beauty. Tight to off stump and holding its line. Cook is well beaten
full length, and turned to midwicket
patted into the off-side
drawn onto the front foot and an elegant-looking drive. But can't beat mid-off
a bit of width for the drive, but Cook finds only the toe-end of his bat. Enough for a single
that's a ripper! One of the few all day to jag genuinely off the seam. Bell was committed to the shot and Sangakkara claimed an easy catch. So much for building an innings, he's gone for a duck
full-length and on middle stump, clipped firmly to midwicket
drawn forward with a straight bat
slower ball, Pietersen reads it well and drives into the covers
good finish to another good over. Just pops a touch off a good length and Pietersen plays a slightly hurried defence
nips off the seam and beats a flailing cut shot
width and smashed, but straight to point
short of a length, steered down to third man with an angled bat
banged in short but straight, Pietersen whips one off the ribs with a flick of the wrists
short and nudged down to gully
that's a massive breakthrough! Maharoof strikes again, and Pietersen is gone! A loose drive grazes the inside-edge, and Sangakkara claims his second catch
pushed into the covers. England need a captain's innings now
worked into the leg-side
pushed into the covers.Time to regroup for England
defended again. What a spell this is from Maharoof
pushed into the covers once again, and that's the end of a potentially matchwinning over
turned into the gap, one more to the total
yorker outside off stump, a proddy defensive stroke
nudged down to third man
outside off stump, and driven with an open blade down to third man
short of a length and climbs into Collingwood's pre-meditated defensive hop
yorker-length, an attempt whip through midwicket, a stifled appeal, and another dot ball
wide and full, mistimed drive back to the bowler
much the same spot, driven with an open face square on the off side and a parried stop by point
attempts a cut by thwacks the ball into his leg and it drops apologetically at his feet
another rasping drive hit straight at the fielder, this time short extra cover
slower ball, Cook bamboozled, he drives, he misses and Sangakkara takes on the second bounce
another slower ball, checked drive to Maharoof's left and he drops as if shot by a sniper and fields smartly
slower, mistimed back to the bowler
fullish, driven, extra cover in quickly, he doesn't field but his approach put the batsmen off running and mid-off mops up
outside off, a swing and a miss. Collingwood blinks and opens his eyes wide as if to say "these lights are rubbish". But he just missed it ...
blocked into the off side
straight drive, timed,  Vaas chases it all the way to the mid-on boundary but abandons the pursuit five yards out
pulled down, Collingwood rocks back, swivels and larrups the ball to deep square leg where it's stopped ... he really got hold of that and it would have stung the hands
dropped full-bloodied drive back at Maharoof's thighs, he can't get his hands down in time and the ball thumps into him and from there into the covers. He winces ...
back-of-a-length and patted into the off side
slower ball but too short, it sits up and asks to be hit but Collingwood can't time it and it trundles through midwicket
another slower one, Jayasuriya at mid-on fields and throws down the stumps, but the second run had been turned down
short and wide, Collingwood leans back and slashes to third man who fields on the bounce
Cook seemed to lose that, trapped on the back foot and it clips his pads but outside the line

slower delivery, Collingwood aims a loose drive, edges it and the ball plops to slip in virtual slow motion. Collingwood doesn't even look round, the bowler's celebrations told him all he needed to know
full, Shah jabs down late. He picked that up at the last minute. It will take a him a few balls top adjust
driven to short mid-on, Shah takes on Jayawardene and wins, the throw misses the stumps in any case
banged in , Cook swivels and helps the ball to deep midwicket. It still didn't get up as much as Cook might have expected
a half-hearted drive and the ball zips past the outside edge
nice length, Shah jabs down and defends
slower but Cook picked it early and thumped that off the back foot to deep cover. A lot of shot for one run
blocked on the walk to mid-on
inside edge into pads, Shah doesn't know where the ball is and starts for the run but is loudly sent back by Cook who sees the ball nestling gently by the stumps
Shah pushes into the off side but into the hands point
pushed towards mid-off from the crease, Shah gambles that extra cover diving it won't pick it up and it pays off
Cook plays it late and fine, third man trots in quickly
Cook waits and slashes off the back foot, backward point picks it up on the bounce
Cook cracks it into the off side, extra cover has to scramble to his right to field
worked from off stump to deep midwicket
bouncer which is called a wide. Fernando  unamused, Cook relieved
slanted across Cook who is left groping at the ball as it passes
quicker and shorter, turned off his hips to deep midwicket who is again smartly in on it and again only the one run
lovely yorker, on the button, and Shah does well to dig it out
full toss as Maharoof aims for the yorker , driven on the bobble to long-on
slower, Shah waits and then clips it back to the right of the diving bowler
edged into pads, the ball dribbles into the off side and Shah is down the pitch like a greyhound to beat the fielder
the first one Shah has really middled, cracked to deep cover
Cook back, it keeps low and he can only pat that into the off side
checked drive to mid-on who throws at the stumps, hits them, even though the batsmen had given up on the run, and the deflection allows an overthrow
wide and full, Cook doesn't get much bat on it and the ball dribbles back down the pitch
wide and that one really took off, Cook held out the bat like a pole, missed, but it was a wide
turned to square leg
ankle-high full toss on leg stump, eased into the on side
pushed back to Malinga

Shah plays the ball way in front of his body, checks the shot and the ball could not have looped more invitingly to short cover had he tried. Shah has looked very out of sorts since he came in and the game is drafting towards an inevitable conclusion
clipped off his toes to backward square leg
blocked with soft hands into the off side, the cover ring are wise to that and converge like flies around ...
this time much the same shot finds the gap
an attempted on drive zips off the outside edge into the off side
steered down to third man
played from the crease with a little jump, cover fields
a sublime shot, a cover drive that purred off the bat and past a diving mid-off ... the crowd appreciates that craft and greets it with ... er ... complete silence
full but too wide, Cook hits it on the half volley but at cover
slower one fools Cook who misses with his drive, Sangakkara gets hit for his pains as the ball bounces a couple of feet in front of him, but he's quick to gather the rebound
Cook can do no more than push into the off side where the ring of fielders are suffocating the England innings
slower ball, Cook pushes towards mid-on and is slow to respond to Bopara's call but still makes his ground
Bopara back and airborne as he pushes to mid-on
slower ball but it trundles down the leg side and reaches Sangakkara with the power of a pensioner running for the bus
short, pulled with a Caribbean-like leg in the air, and all that for one run
cracked off the back foot to wide third man
Cook creasebound and anchor-footed, looks to run the ball to third man, gets a thin edge and is well held low down in front of him by Sangakkara
outside off, not tempted
lovely shot, a jewel in a sea of other stuff, a half volley caressed through cover and a great way to open your international account
good response from Maharoof, on the spot and Swann blocks
Maharoof finds the edge rather than Swann finding it, the balls shoots down to third man where it is well stopped on the slide
straight and defended to short mid-on
clicked down to third man
neatly clipped off his toes
turned into the leg side, another single
short, wide and seemingly down the leg side  ... but not called. Not that it matters too much ...
snorter, short and Swann jags his head back at the last minute as the ball rasps past his chin

back, turned to midwicket, Bopara tries for the quick single and beats the direct hit by a couple of coats of varnish.  He stretched for the crease and that saved him .... a salutatory lesson for children everywhere
a more sedate affair but the same end result
pat and run, and this will be the pattern for some time
a big stride, a push, a pad and no run
steps back and thumps a long hop through the covers, he made room with a shimmy to the leg and picked the gap
premeditated paddle fine on the leg side
solid block to mid-off. Just what the doctor ordered
blocked to the bowler
fired down the leg side, Sangakkara has to leap to his left to gather and Koertzen's arms fly sideways before the ball has been taken
steered with an open face to deep backward point
a wristy and beautifully-timed flick through midwicket, again greeted with total silence
beaten outside the off, Sangakkara drops the ball but recovers before the batsmen realise
good delivery, on off stump, blocked
a reverse sweep that he was in a position to play before the ball had been let go of
clipped off his toes into the leg side
full again, chopped to mid-on
sweeps but misses, the ball comes off the pads - but, apparently a thin edge - and into wide open spaces
on drive not timed, the balls shoots to short fine leg
very wide down the leg side, Swann stands and watches very dismissively
full and he almost yorks himself, extra cover fields
creeps on the money straight away
goes for the second off the sweep and Sri Lanka are celebrating what they think is another run-out from a direct hit, but again they've not got their man and Bopara's dive saves him
worked round the corner
on the money, defended on the front foot
worked into the on-side
swept well into the gap in front of midwicket
on middle, tries to run out Bopara, who was diving back in at the striker's end - but there's no need for a second opinion from the third umpire
pushed right up there and dug out towards mid-on
driven out off the back foot to cover
on leg, turned round the corner
reverse sweep straight to Malinga at backward point - he got hold of it all right, but it flew towards the fielder
starts with a sweep and hesitated in coming back for the second, Malinga with a good return to Sangakkara who takes off the bails with ease
driven off the hips, without much room, to short mid-on
played again off the back foot, patted down
driven more firmly this time, straight past the bowler
defended on the front foot
creeping down leg, and skewed round to fine leg
outside off, worked into the covers and there's some sharp work from Maharoof
driven out to the covers
outside off, worked into short midwicket
chases round a sweep, too late
a bit of air, driven out to the covers
poked away from the body, and misses
Sangakkara is very confident immediately that he has whipped off the bails very quickly - Sidebootom's toe was in the air for only a shade of a second
skews down the leg side, chased round with some kind of sweep
defended on the front foot
swishes away from the body
turned round off the front foot
turned away from the left hander, slightly wide down off, and a thinnish edge flies through, Mahela making no mistake
